The Medical Receptionist, under the direction of the Site Supervisor, is the first point of contact in the facility or via the telephone for our patients. Medical Receptionists duties include providing excellent customer service via the telephone and in person; referring callers to the appropriate department; making appointments for patients; assisting patients with forms and other needs. The Medical Receptionist must exemplify the mission, vision, and values of Professional Physical Therapy by exercising discretion, diplomacy and tact in patient and staff interactions. Essential Functions:
â€¢ Welcomes and greets patients and visitors to the facility in a friendly manner; determines the purpose of the visit; has the patient complete the appropriate paperwork, if necessary; informs the Physical Therapist of their arrival. â€¢ Provides information to those who call the facility; transfers calls as needed; works with the Site Supervisor to ensure proper desk coverage at all times. â€¢ Schedules and cancels appointment as appropriate, ensures follow-up visits are scheduled as appropriate. â€¢ Collects co-payments and post all funds in the EMR/Billing system. â€¢ Records patient information into the EMR/Billing system. â€¢ Prepares flow sheets for the following dayâ€™s appointments; review for accuracy and file them as they are completed each day. â€¢ Filing, faxing and scanning medical records. â€¢ Scan identification and insurance information into the EMR/Billing system. â€¢ Verifies cash balance at the end of every shift. â€¢ When scheduling appointments, carefully screens for patients address, new patient visit, or updated registration information, informs patient of co-pay amount. â€¢ Verifies the method of payment for service (Medicare, private insurance, private payer) and collects payment or data as appropriate. â€¢ Practices confidentiality and privacy protocols in accordance with Company policies and HIPAA requirements. â€¢ Maintains facility waiting area, office files and front desk area in a manner that is neat and organized. â€¢ Receives and conveys messages in writing, electronically and verbally. â€¢ Attends company and departmental meetings as required. â€¢ Other duties as assigned. Qualifications:
â€¢ Must have the ability to exercise a high degree of diplomacy and tact; excellent customer service, communication and interpersonal skills. â€¢ Understands the importance of HIPAA and maintaining confidentiality; adheres to Company policies and HIPAA requirements. â€¢ Must be flexible; able to accommodate the changing needs of the facility. â€¢ Must have basic math skills; must be able to use standard office equipment. â€¢ Must be willing to work nights and/or weekends; must be able to work a rotating schedule between the hours of 7am and 8pm. â€¢ Must have the ability to travel as required to perform job duties.

As a family owned business in its third generation, the Company represents some of the leading names in the electrical industry, including Fortune 500 companies and exceptional independently owned American manufacturing partners.

Prepare promotional materials and literatures
Post online content on the company’s website and social media accounts
Assist with marketing literature to augment the company’s presence in the market

Act as the point of contact between management and internal/external clients

This function will be a critical factor for the smooth operation of the Marketing department and the attainment of its goals, as well as for the long-term growth of the company.
Thea and Schoen is a leading independent manufacturer’s representative sales and marketing agency in the Electrical Industry. As a family owned business in its third generation, the Company represents some of the leading names in the electrical industry, including Fortune 500 companies and exceptional independently owned American manufacturing partners.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Undertake daily administrative tasks to ensure the functionality and coordination of the department’s activities
Support Outside and Inside Sales associates in organizing various projects
Update spreadsheets, databases and inventories with statistical, financial and non-financial information
Assist in the organizing of promotional events and campaigns to facilitate its success
Prepare promotional materials and literatures
Post online content on the company’s website and social media accounts
Assist with marketing literature to augment the company’s presence in the market
Communicate directly with clients and encourage trusting relationships
Act as the point of contact between management and internal/external clients
Handle requests and queries appropriately
Make travel and lunch meetings arrangements
Monitor office/breakroom supplies and research advantageous deals or suppliers
Produce reports, presentations and briefs
Receptionist phone coverage back-up
Job Type: Full-time
Work authorization:
United States (Required)


Job Description
Medical Receptionist/Front Desk*
Job Summary: The medical receptionist is responsible to attend to patients on the phone and in person, coordinate and organize appointments and documentation to facilitate the smooth running of the healthcare environment and support delivery of quality patient care.
Minimum Requirements:
High school diploma or equivalent.
Completion of a medical assistant certificate program preferred.
1+ years of experience working as a medical receptionist/administrative assistant in the health care field.
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work independently or as part of a team
Essential Functions:
Greet patients and other visitors to the medical office.
Answer patient questions and provide assistance and directions when necessary.
Field all phone calls that arrive using our general office number.
Utilize medical office software to schedule new and follow-up appointments for patients.
Register new patients and update necessary records.
Distribute forms and paperwork to patients to ensure that required fields are completed appropriately.
Maintain confidentiality of all patient records.
Completing insurance verifications, authorizations and referrals.
Knowledge of Workers Compensation and auto claim submissions.
Manage inventory of necessary office supplies and coordinate reordering.
Other duties as assigned.
Equal Opportunity Employer

Deliver on service commitments in a timely and accurate manner
Invest proper effort and QC approach to deliver highest quality work and service
Comply with EPIQ’s standards of operations as set forth in the contract agreement, the site operations manual, and the employee handbook
Expected to uphold the Standards of Service and best practices developed by EPIQ
RESPONSIBILITIES:
General:
Monitor and listen to clients to understand inquiries and requests in order to provide accurate information about the facilities and services with prompt assistance
Perform basic mathematical calculations using a calculator/computer to accurately figure production time and labor time associated with any copy, print, scan or production requests
Follow established guidelines and procedures for receiving, documenting, organizing and mailing out client packages (i.e. parcel deliveries, messenger services, etc.)
Ensure accurate tracking, monitoring and recording of all charges, overtime, logs and entries throughout his/her shift
Answering telephone inquiries, loading/unloading parcels, delivering of parcels, copying, and faxing and guest requests
Due to the cyclical nature of the industry team members may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the firm
Reception:
Work closely with the client's staff to ensure seamless day-to-day operations as the first line of contact with the client's visitors
Answer incoming telephone calls and direct call traffic to the proper person
Take accurate and complete messages for those employees who may be unavailable
Greet and announce visitors in a friendly and business-like manner
Maintain neatness and organization of reception desk and front closet areas with various administrative duties as outlined by the Site Manager

High School Diploma or equivalent
Minimum of 1 year professional level work experience
Previous experience in a client service oriented field preferred
Willingness and ability to learn new skills

Ability to function with a high level of patience, tact and diplomacy in handling any ¡§complaint¡¨ situations

Ability to walk, bend, kneel, stand, and/or sit for an extended period of time
Manual dexterity required for operating office machinery (phone, copy machines, binding equipment, etc)
Working knowledge of Microsoft products pertaining to the specific position including but not limited to Outlook, Word, and Excel etc
Reading, writing, and arithmetic skills required
Visual acuity
Able to convey information and ideas through speech in ways that others will understand
Able to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences
Able to speak clearly so listeners understand, identify and understand the speech of another person
Excellent organizational skills

It is Epiq’s policy to comply with all applicable equal employment opportunity laws by making all employment decisions without unlawful regard or consideration of any individual’s race, religion, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expressions, transgender status, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, marital status, age, national origin, genetic information, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, veteran or family status or any other basis protected by applicable national, federal, state, provincial or local law. Epiq’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on any of these impermissible bases, as well as any bases or grounds protected by applicable law in each jurisdiction. In addition Epiq will take affirmative action for minorities, women, covered veterans and individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. Epiq is pleased to provide such assistance and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request. Pursuant to relevant law, where applicable, Epiq will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.


Children’s Specialized Hospital is the nation’s leading provider of inpatient and outpatient care for children from birth to 21 years of age facing special health challenges — from chronic illnesses and complex physical disabilities like brain and spinal cord injuries, to developmental and behavioral issues like autism and mental health. At 13 different New Jersey locations, our pediatric specialists partner with families to make our many innovative therapies and medical treatments more personalized and effective...so children can achieve more of their goals. Job Summary
Responsible for providing exemplary customer service utilizing the Service Excellence Standards set forth by the organization while interacting with all customers internal and external. Responsible for obtaining intake information accurately in order to schedule single or multiple appointments for services within the organization utilizing the hospital computer scheduling system. Schedules new patients and follow up appointments for medical and therapy departments throughout the organization. Disseminates needed information to hospital staff as needed. Essential Job Functions
Obtains accurate clinical information in order to make a sound judgment as to which services are required for the appointment(s).
Obtains intake information, including demographics, insurance information, referrals, and scripts timely and accurately.
Schedules appropriate appointments based on reason for referral and intake information. Schedules follow up|therapy first treatment appointments when needed.
Interacts with both internal and external customers adhering to the Service Excellence Standards.
Adheres to the productivity expectations as determined by the leadership team.
Adheres to departmental quality standards for scheduling appointments and interacting with customers either in person or via the telephone.
When appropriate interacts with designated therapy leaders and ACC leaders to schedule new patients and follow up appointments for medical and therapy departments throughout the organization.

STATEMENT OF JOB:
The Receptionist is the official representative of the organization at the front desk and on the telephone. The receptionist will attend to the main telephone, handle all incoming and outgoing calls in a pleasant manner, and greet all visitors or residents who come to the desk. The receptionist will also be responsible for such other related clerical duties as the work load may permit. Duties include but are not limited to the following:
Answer telephones and handle all inquiries according to company protocols
Greet visitors and prospects according to company protocol
Provide tours to prospects as requested

Monitor Sundry Shop operation if appropriate

Maintain adequate supply of fully assembled marketing materials

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma
* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma
* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:

High End dental office seeking a full-time Front Desk Receptionist. Salary commensurate with experience. A minimum of two years experience in the dental field is required. Knowledge of Dentrix is a plus but not mandatory. Applicant must be upbeat, personable and flexible. Possessing the ability to work as a team player and care for the patients at the highest possible standards is expected. SUMMARY: Responsible for patient scheduling, registration and all functions related to the facilitation of patient visits/care within the Faculty Practice at SOM. Performs duties in a high customer service manner and provides patient and family-centered service, always putting the needs of the patients/family first during encounters.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following:
Represents image of the practice to patients, community and institution through personal and telephone contact with an emphasis on high customer service. Receives, greets, directs and/or escorts patients, family members/visitors, and physicians as appropriate, in a friendly and courteous manner.
Coordinate with other scheduling areas both within and outside of Rowan SOM and/or insurance carriers to facilitate patient navigation including, but not limited to, scheduling of patient appointments, referrals or authorizations.
Obtains and verifies (or confirms that automated verification was received) accurate demographic and insurance information. Ensures all information is updated and accurate in patient management software during each patient visit. Notifies coordinator/manager of any problem with obtaining complete registration information.
Collects co-payments and monies (account balances) due at time of service. Posts payment into system and logs all payments received. Reconciles monies on hand with payment batch listing at end of session/day. Prepares deposit, daily reconciliation worksheet and charge batch for manager’s review.
Issues referrals, checks referrals for completeness and correctness of information and issues accurately within 48-72 hours of request, urgent request accommodated as needed.
Ensures all patients are capitated to the practice prior to the visit, and help patients locate their primary or to facilitate a change to a Rowan SOM primary care provide as requested (only applies to PCP practices).
Responds to any request within limits of qualification and/or refers request to appropriate staff member in a timely manner.
Answers multi-line telephone system using appropriate telephone etiquette, is courteous and helpful, correctly triages calls or takes a complete and accurate message, schedule appointments following established guidelines. Provides information in accordance with patient confidentiality standards.
Makes calls to confirm appointments, verifies correct insurance and billing information prior to appointment and makes appropriate notes in the system as needed.
Review daily reports from automated reminder service and make the appropriate schedule changes. Records all cancellations and no-shows. Contacts no-show patients to reschedule per the departmental guidelines.
Responsible for scheduling ancillary services, pre-certification/authorizations, schedule future follow up appointments and provide the patient with an appointment reminder card.
Handles recall appointments and assist manager with quality measure projects.
Perform time of service charge entry and resolve coding issues. Checks encounter forms or other billing documentation for completeness and accuracy.
Resolve/correct patient registration and scheduling issues as defined by Revenue Cycle quality initiatives within the stated timeframes for the front end edits and rejections.
Encourage patients to complete the patient satisfaction survey per Faculty Practice Plan guidelines.
Perform "End of Day" and next day preparation activities per Faculty Practice Plan guidelines.
Perform other assigned duties. QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: High School graduate or equivalent. At least one year of clerical experience, preferably involving receptionist and scheduling duties in a medical office or clinical setting is required. Typing/word processing skills and excellent customer service skills are required. Please be advised that some positions are subject to the residency requirements of the NJ First Act (N.J.S.A. 52:14-7, P.L. 2011, Chapter 70). Any person hired into identified positions shall either have their principal residence in New Jersey or they have one year from the date of employment to establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey. The law also provides that any person may petition a State committee for an exemption from the requirements based on critical need or hardship.
Rowan University values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity in employment.
All positions are contingent upon budget appropriations.
The Stratford, NJ Campus is a Tobacco-Free Workplace.
SALARY:
$17.23 per hour

Our mission is to provide a consistent and innovative customer experience for each member to realize their true fitness potential; making America a healthier place 1 visit, 1 rep, 1 mile at a time.

All Front Desk employees are to wear company staff shirt along with either Khaki pants or black athletic pants. Sneakers must always be worn. No boots, heals, or open toe shoes or sandals. Front Desk staff should always be well groomed and neat. Opening shift employees are required to be inside the facility 15 minutes prior to scheduled opening time ensuring all items on the Opening Checklist are performed before members arrive. Closing employees are to close the facility at the established time. Employees are not to count money until all members have left the Retro Fitness outlet and the doors have been locked.

We are seeking a Full-Time and Experienced Full-Time Front End Dental Administrator with knowledge of dental software (preferably Dentrix, but willing to train the right person) to join our team! (Preferably looking for someone with a background in dental assisting but who wants to work predominantly in the front.)
We are a small, down-to-earth, and professional office looking for a team player who is confident enough to work at the front-end part of the office and must have the ability to multi-task. Salary is based on skill level and type of experience.
Must have great attention to detail, be very organized, and motivated to grow. Our ideal candidate should have a very friendly, warm and professional personality. Someone who has great interpersonal skills and who enjoys cultivating relationships with staff and patients. You should be capable of prioritizing, multi-tasking, and handling multiple phone lines, and exude a very positive image of our office. Our ideal candidate should be capable of executing all the front-end duties of our dental practice, including but not limited to the following:
Responsibilities:
Scheduling patients based on productivity for all dental procedures including surgeries and hygiene.
Being able to fill gaps in the schedule ahead of time by proactively reaching out to patients who need to schedule.
Composing, presenting, and explaining both simple and complex treatment plans to patients.
Collecting payments from patients on a daily basis and sending out monthly billing statements.
Sending claims to insurance companies and posting payments from insurance claims.
Calling insurance claims to follow-up on denial of payments, and submitting claim appeals.
Collecting information from new patients and adding them to dental system.
Creating reports to follow-up on patients who need to reschedule their appointments.
Creating reports to follow-up on insurance claims that were not processed.
Verifying patients' insurance and communicating to patients what benefits they are eligible for.
Using the ADA dental coding system to input all dental procedures.
Attaching narratives and claims to insurance companies.
Calling in prescriptions for patients and referring them to other doctors or specialists when needed.
Facilitate referrals to other healthcare professionals and medical facilities.
Update and maintain accurate patient medical records.
Qualifications:
Previous experience in a dental office either as a front-end administrator, dental assistant, or hygienist.
Familiarity with dental software, preferably Dentrix or something similar.
Ability to build rapport with patients.
Ability to be proactive and carry out tasks without someone asking you to.
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

Job Summary
Answer and properly direct incoming calls to the proper divisions of Verizon, strictly adhering to the call routing documents.
Answer and direct all calls in a friendly, professional manner, taking messages with accuracy. Always put a smile in one’s voice and enhance personalization by using names.
Utilize strong communication skills when interfacing with all groups.
Properly greet and handle visitors to the company with a smile and maintain eye contact throughout the entire interaction. Follow established procedures with regard to both expected and unexpected arrivals. Address guests and clients by name whenever possible.
Direct visitors to their destination.
Notify Verizon employee upon visitor arrival to request visitor escort (if required)
Ensure all e-mails and voice mails have been checked and handled accordingly prior to leaving.
Continual communication and interface with all departments throughout the site (Building maintenance, IT, AV, Housekeeping and Mailroom) when necessary.
Ability to interface with Senior Clients on a one-on-one basis.
Assist department administrative staff in the daily reservations and guest requirements as needed.
Immediately report safety and security abnormalities to C&W facilities staff.
Implement security policies and procedures established by Verizon with regard to arriving and departing visitors, contractors, delivery persons, etc.
Business casual clothing required at all times; must be polished.
Maintain professional appearance of Reception area
Assist guests with print services, including photocopying, printing, facsimile requests. Partner with Verizon IT as needed.
Have a thorough understanding of Verizon’s site-specific emergency procedures and be prepared to carry out designated tasks in the event of a fire or other emergency.
Note: during times of inclement weather, the executive receptionist may be asked to house in a nearby hotel at company expense to ensure no interruption in service. REQUIREMENTS:
Proficiency in Excel, Word and Outlook.
Strong interpersonal communication and customer service skills.
Ability to answer and direct calls accurately and professionally.
Professional appearance, maintains professionalism at all times.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and under varying stressful conditions with a patient, calm and friendly demeanor.
Excellent organizational skills, flexibility and the ability to prioritize work.
Ability to multitask and carry out responsibilities with little supervision.
Proactive mindset to anticipate and support changes in the business.
Polished, professional approach. Must have ability to engage with Verizon Senior Executives and their guests. About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry

SUMMARY
Under regular supervision, carries out receptionist and telephone answering functions, clinical appointment scheduling and clinical record filing. Provides general office clerical support.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Greets patients and visitors in a prompt and courteous manner, and facilitates adherence to schedule of appointments.
Schedules/cancels/confirms patients’ appointments according to the criteria of the department. Provides accurate information such as directions, pre-visit instructions, insurance form requirements, etc.
Registers patients completely and accurately, ensuring that pertinent data is obtained from patient and entered into computer system or updated as needed.
Answers phone calls, takes accurate messages, and refers caller or message to appropriate party.
As directed, communicates with various hospitals and physician offices regarding patient related information and documents. Provides information in accordance with patient confidentiality standards.
Requisitions and returns patient charts on a daily basis.
Maintains an accurate filing system to meet the needs of the department, following established guidelines. Ensures that charts, lab slips, x-ray reports, etc are filed and/or retrieved in a timely manner.
Assists with billing procedures and forms as directed.
Develops and maintains good customer relations skills consistent with the department’s guidelines.
Understands and adheres to legacy UMDNJ compliance standards as they appear in the Corporate Compliance Policy, Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest Policy.
Performs other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
At least one (1) year of clerical experience, preferably involving receptionist and scheduling duties in a medical office or clinical setting, required. Typing/word processing skills and excellent customer service skills required.

Vanguard is looking for a full-time Medical Receptionist in our Cranford location. This position requires one night per week and one Saturday per month.
Vanguard Medical Group is an independent primary care group practice with 10 offices in Northern and Central New Jersey. We are committed to providing evidence-based healthcare that achieves the quality outcomes that improve the health and safety of our patients and the populations we manage. We also strive to take care of our people, and that's not just patients. We want to ensure that our clinical and administrative staff have a good work-life balance, are engaged at VMG, and experience joy at work.
Position Overview:
The Medical Receptionist is responsible for basic clerical tasks such as answering phones, greeting patients and visitors and scheduling appointments in a professional and timely manner. The Medical Receptionist may be responsible for both administrative and clinical duties.
Job Responsibilities:
Welcomes and greets all patients and visitors, whether in person or over the phone and acts as a liaison between patient and provider.
Maintains a polite, consistent phone manner using pleasant telephone etiquette.
Keeps the reception area clean, organized and ready at the start of each working day.
Registers new patients and updates existing patient demographics by collecting patient information including personal and financial information during the check in process.
Facilitates patient flow by notifying the Medical Assistants of patient arrival, being aware of delays, and clearly communicating status with patients and clinical staff.
Keeps medical office supplies adequately stocked by anticipating inventory needs, placing orders, and monitoring office equipment.
Protects patient confidentiality by making sure protected health information is secured, not visible to other patients and logging off the computer before leaving it unattended.
Obtains pre-certification for any required procedures or medications.
Maintains clear and timely written and verbal communications between patient and provider via phone or Taskman.
Relays information clearly to patient on preparation for appointments, lab tests, procedures and referrals.
Performs all other clerical duties as assigned by Vanguard Medical Group. Skills/Qualifications:
High school diploma or graduation equivalency degree (GED)
Minimum 1 year prior medical receptionist experience required. 1+ preferred
Knowledge of basic medical terminology
Basic computer skills, including Word and Excel
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and organizational skills

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility

* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

Observes and reports incidents or suspicious activity to client representatives, company management, life/safety personnel.
Prepares logs or reports as required for site; writes and/or types reports and/or enters information in a computer using standard grammar; inspects security control logs and takes action as required.
Provides administrative support, such as answering telephone, taking and delivering messages or transferring calls to voice mail when appropriate personnel are unavailable.
Requirements
With or without reasonable accommodation, the physical and mental requirements of this job may include the following: seeing, hearing, speaking, and writing clearly. Occasional reaching with hands and arms, stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling. Frequent sitting, standing and walking, which may be required for long periods of time, and may involve climbing stairs and walking up inclines and on uneven terrain. Additional physical requirements may include, frequent lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds and occasional lifting and/or moving up to 25 pounds.
Keyboarding, basic computer usage and operating controls; may be required to operate various software applications.

Founded in 2011 by executives at Equinox, Blink Fitness is a premium quality, value-based fitness brand with more than 90 locations open or in development throughout New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and California. Blink puts Mood Above Muscle™, which celebrates the positive feeling you get from exercise, not just the physical benefits.
Blink recently launched a franchising system to complement its fast growing company-owned business model and has secured franchise development agreements in Georgia, Illinois, Massachusetts, Michigan, Virginia and upstate NY. This includes an agreement with Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green, two-time NBA Champion, All Star, Olympic Gold Medalist and Defensive Player of the Year, who announced a franchise development deal to bring 20 gyms to his home state of Michigan and to Illinois.
Blink is an exciting and dynamic business that is still in the start-up mode. We are a passionate team with a great entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to roll up our sleeves to get the work done.
While Blink has grown rapidly and has already achieved significant profitability, the business is just getting warmed-up. Its leadership has a very lofty vision and expects explosive growth over the coming years. At a minimum, the business expects to have more than 300 locations over the next five years through a combination of corporate and franchise development.
For more information visit Blink’s consumer website - blinkfitness.com – and its franchise website – blinkfranchising.com.
Job Overview:
At Blink, this role is called a Moodlifter, but until that is a word job seekers are typing into Google, we will stick with using the more widely known title of Front Desk Associate! What is a Moodlifter you ask? Moodlifters are the people who greet each of our members with ear to ear smiles, over the top enthusiasm and pretty much know everyone in the gym by name. They will run to open the door for you in a driving rainstorm and change a channel so you don’t miss a minute of the big game. They consistently go above and beyond and you can’t help but smile when you see them.
Responsibilities:
Greet every member and guest with enthusiasm and a smile
Tour potential members around the club with the goal of signing up the person for a membership
Answer phone calls in a professional and energetic manner
Execute all opening/closing operational procedures to ensure the club runs smoothly
Handle member requests and concerns with a sense of urgency
Actively participate in ensuring the club is spotless including frequent bending, lifting, and walking around the club to organize equipment and straighten up
Sign members up for startup sessions with Blink Personal Trainers
Maintain regular and punctual attendance
Comply with all company policies and procedures
Qualifications:
Enthusiastic, energetic, friendly and personable
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Able to lift and move gym equipment weighing 15-20 lbs frequently and 45 lbs occasionally
Able to remain in a stationary position at the front desk for the majority of the workday
World class customer service skills
Works hard, multi-tasks and is a problem solver
Passion for the Blink brand
Compensation and Benefits:
Complimentary Blink Membership
Benefits

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma
* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma
* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

Schedule appointments, reschedule, follow up with no calls, no shows, the discharge of patients, and follow up appointments. Answer inbound calls to the practice, as well as, greet vendors and set vendor appointments. Will convey messages in writing, electronically, and verbally. Will maintain Physicians calendars, prepares doctors notes, return to work, school, or leave notices and all other correspondence as directed. Scanning, filing, and faxing documents, as well as, prepare and sort mail. Ensure the waiting and reception areas are kept orderly and clean, and will report on any damages of furniture, supplies, or equipment. Act as a liaison with patients, referrals, general practitioners, health care professionals, and patient’s family member in a compassionate and kind manner. Supporting the Most Exciting and Meaningful Missions in the World
Receptionist / Biometrics Technician, PART TIME
Hybrid position needed for the United States Citizenship and Immigration (USCIS) Application Support Center (ASC) operations. As the Receptionist / Biometric Technician, you will be responsible for supporting the location in ELIZABETH, NJ. The Receptionist / Biometrics Technician is a part time team member with the primary responsibility of meeting and greeting visitors to the ASC; checking the hands of applicants for open wounds or cuts, distributing the Applicant Information Worksheet (AIW), and checking applicant identification documents to include the initial applicant processing actions; and answering routine inquires for information or referring requests to the appropriate source within the office.
A secondary duty of Biometrics Technician would be needed in completing biometric registration (fingerprints and identity capture) as needed.
Part time employees can be scheduled 20 hours a week depending on authorized staffing and site needs. Additional hours may be needed to assist with higher applicant volume. The candidate for the part time position must be available to work M-F between the hours of 7:45 a.m. – 4:15 p.m.
No experience needed as all required job training will be provided.
This position is available immediately; we are actively conducting interviews and encourage you to apply.
Highlights of Responsibilities:
Greet applicants with the highest of customer service by smiling, being open and willing to assist and being sensitive to applicants who may not speak English
Being creative in how you communicate with applicants who do not speak English or where English is not their primary language
Reviewing the applicants appointment notices to ensure they are scheduled for that day
Reviewing the applicants identification(s) to ensure they are the person identified on the application notice
Refer applicants to the appropriate authority if there are issues with their paperwork and/or identification(s)
Provide paperwork to applicants with instructions
Provide applicants with a service number or other method depending on the site and explain the next steps in the process
Assisted with crown control and instructions as needed
As a secondary job requirement, this position may be needed to capture biometrics (fingerprinting and identity) processing. At these times, the employee will be paid at a higher rate of pay while completing biometrics on applicants. Duties for Biometrics Technician include:
Process applicants for biometrics capture.
Review immigration and biometrics documentation.
Perform biometrics processing to include capturing electronic fingerprints, photographs, and signatures.
Proof and check work for accuracy and completeness and maintain a 98% efficiency rating for all processed forms.
Provide the highest level of customer service to all applicants.
Track processing time for each applicant.
Safeguard all documents.
Perform additional administrative duties as needed.
Requirements:
Must be able to obtain and maintain a government issued suitability clearance.
High School Diploma or equivalent.
Demonstrated experience in customer service.
Ability to work in a high paced environment with the general public.
Ability to stand upright on one’s feet for scheduled shift duration, excluding meals and breaks.
Ability to hold and grasp applicant’s hands to obtain quality fingerprints.
Ability to type and use basic computer programs.
Successful completion of company administered training program.
Preferred Experience:
Ability to speak a foreign language.

Position Overview: Receptionists serve visitors by greeting, welcoming, and directing them appropriately. They will be responsible for notifying the company personnel of visitors arrival and maintain the security and telecommunications system.
Responsibilities of the Receptionists:
Welcome visitors by greeting them, in person or on the telephone; answering or referring inquiries
Directs visitors by maintaining employee and department directories; giving instructions
Maintains safe and clean reception area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations
Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Calendar management: Update calendars and schedule meetings
Order front office supplies and keep inventory of stock
Arrange travel and accommodations, and prepare vouchers
Keep updated records of office expenses and costs
Perform other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, transcribing and faxing.
Qualifications for the Receptionists:
Telephone Skills, Verbal Communication, Microsoft Office Skills, Listening, Professionalism, Customer Focus, Organization, Informing Others, Handles Pressure, Phone Skills, Supply Management
Polished, professional presentation
Ability to commit to assignment and show up on time
Excellent verbal skills
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher
Minimum one year of corporate work experience in a similar role.
Millennium Solution Focus, Inc. (MSF) is a computer consulting and training firm based in Bloomfield, New Jersey. Our firm takes pride in providing quality consulting solutions for small to large corporate and private businesses, along with providing excellent training services to students from all walks of life.
Our consulting division focuses primarily on Web application planning, design, development, implementation and configuration with the incorporation of database management, administration and warehousing. The consulting department also handles vast networks powered by Microsoft and Cisco networking servers and equipment, dealing with its design, implementation, configuration and troubleshooting tactics.

Location: Lakewood, NJ Category: Support Staff Posted On: Thu Aug 1 2019 Job Description:
Maintains the daily operations of the Admissions Welcome Center including greeting visitors, answering phones, processing requests of students, families, faculty and staff. This position supports the recruitment efforts of the admissions counselors in meeting the recruitment goals.
Coordinate all campus visits including, partnership HS, campus tours, instant decision days and other such events that bring individuals or groups to campus for the purpose of recruitment.
Host welcoming environment for guests of campus on the phone, in email and in person within the Admissions Welcome Center.
Provide resources to counselors, faculty and staff that are attending off site recruitment opportunities.
Prepare and mail admissions materials.
Essential Functions
Must be an enthusiastic, people-oriented person that enjoys working with high school and college students.
Must have exceptional organization skills, a keen sense of details and have an ability to do a multitude of tasks.
Strong computer skills for coordinating campus visits with multiple software systems & campus partners.
Detail orientated person that helps coordinate multiple offices and departments in the delivery of strong customer service.
Must be comfortable utilizing and learning multiple software for completion of daily work.
Expertise in generating letters through mail merge and excel for and recruitment communications for mailing.
Reviewing and managing of event registrations and communications.
Providing support at on-campus admissions events including information sessions, open houses, accepted students day and enrollment events.
Must be able to communicate with prospective students and parents and guidance counselors as part of the application and enrollment processes.
Evening and weekend work will be required on scheduled event dates and during peak admission cycles.
Integrating the core values of respect, compassion, integrity, justice and service in all aspects of interaction.
Other duties as assigned. Job Requirements:
The minimum qualifications for this position are:
High School diploma or some college credits.
Excellent professional demeanor
Proficiency using Microsoft Office, especially Word, Excel, and other email, database and spreadsheet applications.
Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal and relationship-building skills with the ability to communicate clearly in person and writing
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees, students and the general public
Ability to maintain the highest degree of confidentiality
Ability to work independently, completing work in a thorough and timely manner and balancing competing demands with courtesy and tact
Ability to quickly learn and retain a large body of general University information, including activities, functions, personnel, rules, policies, regulations, procedures, etc.
The preferred but not required qualifications for this position are:
Associates or Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Experience using student information systems, customer relationship management (CRM) systems.
Bilingual
Event planning skills Additional Information:

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma
* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Office Administration: 1 year (Preferred)
Customer Service, knowledge of switch board operation: 1 year (Required)
Receptionist: 2 years (Preferred)
Benefits offered:
Paid time off
Health insurance
Dental insurance
Healthcare spending or reimbursement accounts such as HSAs or FSAs
Other types of insurance
Retirement benefits or accounts
Education assistance or tuition reimbursement
Employee discounts

Our Mission: To improve lives by providing comprehensive, high-quality healthcare to every person in every com
Registration Specialist Job Description
POSITION SUMMARY:
Registration Specialist Job Description
POSITION SUMMARY:
Arranges for the efficient and orderly registration of CCHN patients by ensuring that accurate patient information is collected and that patients receive an optimum level of professionalism and office experience.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
• Registers patients for services, entering and verifying all patient demographics and billing information at time of check in.
Assist patients with navigating the kiosk registration process
Provides excellent customer service skills; greets patients politely and promptly whether over the phone or in person
Must portray a positive, courteous and professional manner to patients, families, visitors, co-workers and physicians
Responsible for insurance verification of patients
Collect co-pays
Obtains necessary patient information and documents, signatures of consent for treatment, release of information and other CCHN forms and scans to computer
Direct patients to relevant areas of building
Task messages to nurses
Sends faxes, retrieves and routes incoming faxes
Understands the organizations financial assistance policy and refers uninsured patients to access to care counselors
Must be flexible with the willingness to work different shifts
Maintains strict confidentiality regarding knowledge of all patient information (HIPAA), staff and confidential facility business
Must recognize the importance this position plays in the community and must convey a caring and professional image in all interaction
Ability to remain calm, professional and focused on performing multiple tasks with many interruptions in a high stress, fast paced environment
Keep areas clean and organized
Follow CCHN policies and practices
Registration Specialist Job Description
POSITION SUMMARY:
Arranges for the efficient and orderly registration of CCHN patients by ensuring that accurate patient information is collected and that patients receive an optimum level of professionalism and office experience.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
• Registers patients for services, entering and verifying all patient demographics and billing information at time of check in.
Assist patients with navigating the kiosk registration process
Provides excellent customer service skills; greets patients politely and promptly whether over the phone or in person
Must portray a positive, courteous and professional manner to patients, families, visitors, co-workers and physicians
Responsible for insurance verification of patients
Collect co-pays
Obtains necessary patient information and documents, signatures of consent for treatment, release of information and other CCHN forms and scans to computer
Direct patients to relevant areas of building
Task messages to nurses
Sends faxes, retrieves and routes incoming faxes
Understands the organizations financial assistance policy and refers uninsured patients to access to care counselors
Must be flexible with the willingness to work different shifts
Maintains strict confidentiality regarding knowledge of all patient information (HIPAA), staff and confidential facility business
Must recognize the importance this position plays in the community and must convey a caring and professional image in all interaction
Ability to remain calm, professional and focused on performing multiple tasks with many interruptions in a high stress, fast paced environment
Keep areas clean and organized
Follow CCHN policies and practices
JOB SPECIFICATIONS:
•Skills: Ability to read, write legibly and comprehend the written and spoken word in English; basic computer literacy and ability to effectively learn new software programs required; Typing (45 wpm.), data entry, telephone answering etiquette, copy machine
• Requirements of Employment:
Education: High school diploma or equivalent
Experience: Minimum two years receptionist/cashier or other related experience/business school training, Hospital/Medical/Office/Medical terminology preferred
Supervised by: Site Practice Manager

Keep areas clean and organized

Position Overview: As a Receptionist, you will deliver friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all of our guests and residents with the key aim of retaining and attracting new customers.
Competencies:
* Listening, understanding, responding: Deals with a diverse group of important external callers and visitors as well as internal contacts at all levels of the organization. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize and organize diversified workload, recommends changes in office practices or procedures.
* Customer Service: Interacts with fellow co-workers, all employees in the facility, physicians, visitors, and all other customers in a manner that encourages harmonious working relationships, enhances the image and reputation of the facility and promotes positive customer relations.
* Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services. Has a commitment to professional and personal growth through development of skills and knowledge, as well as improvement in the facility’s performance.
* Integrity: Uphold personal and professional ethics and values, taking into account the values of the organization and respecting the culture, beliefs and abilities of individuals.
* Personal Effectiveness/Credibility: Ability to promise and deliver results, build effective relationships and establish a reliable track record.
Specific Responsibilities:
* Answering incoming phone calls to facility
* Directs calls to the appropriate individual
* Greets guests, new clients, and residents with warmth and passion
* Assists in handling of incoming and outgoing mail
* Filing
* Ordering supplies
* Handling all maintenance orders for the facility
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma
* Prior experience working with the public required
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of switch board operation
* Clerical and customer service skills
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Adhere to strict confidentiality with focus on sensitive material, HIPAA
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Travel: Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:

Retro Fitness General Manager Retro Fitness Mission Statement Retro Fitness is a Health Club built on the respect and dedication for each of our members who entrust us to help them achieve their health and fitness goals. Our mission is to provide a consistent and innovative customer experience for each member to realize their true fitness potential; making America a healthier place 1 visit, 1 rep, 1 mile at a time.
Responsibilities of Front Desk Staff Member
Greeting and checking in members as they come in.
Resolving member issues in an effective manner.
Membership sales and retention.
Following up with prospects.
Selling in-store merchandise such as Retro Blends Smoothies, Cooler Drinks, Pro Shop items, etc.
Ensuring a safe and clean environment for all members and staff.
Applicable downtime tasks provided by Management may include upkeep & walk throughs of facility.
Opening and closing the facility if scheduled.
Following company policies and procedures.
All Front Desk employees are to wear company staff shirt along with either Khaki pants or black athletic pants. Sneakers must always be worn. No boots, heals, or open toe shoes or sandals. Front Desk staff should always be well groomed and neat. Opening shift employees are required to be inside the facility 15 minutes prior to scheduled opening time ensuring all items on the Opening Checklist are performed before members arrive. Closing employees are to close the facility at the established time. Employees are not to count money until all members have left the Retro Fitness outlet and the doors have been locked.

The Admin Asst, Student Affairs and Wellbeing position is to provide high-level support to the Associate/Assistant Dean and Director(s) for the Office of Student Affairs and Wellbeing in the School of Medicine. Provide administrative and general office support to include personal and telephone reception, preparation of correspondence data input, and filing. This role is critical in being proactive and demonstrating initiative to the office's project management processes.
Responsibilities
1. Provides primary administrative support to the Associate Assistant Dean and/or Directors of the Office of Student Affairs and Wellbeing to include scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, organizing travel arrangements, preparing/organizing / filing correspondence and managing calendars.
2. Investigates, organizes and inputs pertinent information into constituent management software.
3. Coordinates and plans meeting locations, dates, and related arrangements. Organizes and prepares training materials; communicates with internal / external trainers, volunteers (when present), and attendees regarding training sessions and/or meetings; records notes and minutes; documents and distributes evaluation materials and action items for follow up.
4. Assists the Associate / Assistant Dean and/or Directors of Student Affairs and Wellbeing with key department projects/priorities, to include reviewing reports and assisting with planning as directed by the Office of Student Affairs and Wellbeing.
5. Prepares reports/forms, travel authorizations and other disbursement requests.
6. Assists the Associate / Assistant Dean and/or Directors of Student Affairs and Wellbeing with administrative support of special projects such as data entry and limited content updating as required.
7. Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
8. Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
Qualifications

1. Associate's degree or Vocational or Technical School degree.
2. Minimum of 1 year of relevant work experience.
3. Excellent oral and written communication skills.
4. Ability to track and manage budgets and limited purchasing.
5. Problem solving capability in addition to the ability to work within general guidelines established by the manager.
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
1.Bachelor's degree
